summary: Squid has enabled swaps simultaneously across Ethereum, various Ethereum Virtual Machine blockchains and the Cosmos ecosystem.
title: Squid unveils direct swaps across Cosmos and EVM blockchains
content: Squid, a protocol specializing in cross-chain swaps, has expanded its services to facilitate liquidity routing and token swaps across the Ethereum ETH -0.80% blockchain, various Ethereum Virtual Machine blockchains, and the Cosmos ecosystem.

By integrating Axelar Network and adopting the Cosmos Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) protocol, along with a partnership with the decentralized exchange network Osmosis OSMO -1.91% , Squid has broadened its capabilities to encompass tokens swaps across both EVM and Cosmos blockchain ecosystems simultaneously.
In January, Squid raised a $3.5 million seed round led by North Island Ventures.
Transferring assets between EVM and Cosmos blockchains can be complex due to their inherent incompatibility. Squid, which is built on the Axelar AXL -5.73% Network, seeks to address this issue.

Squid uses Axelar’s General Message Passing (GMP) technology in conjunction with the IBC protocol. The combination enables the transport of both tokens and smart contract logic between the Cosmos and EVM ecosystems.

"By making cross-chain token swaps among both Cosmos and EVM blockchains trivial, Squid extends this vision of interoperability and lowers the barrier to economic collaboration across these ecosystems," said Fig, the pseudonymous co-founder of Squid.
